body.name: Earlex SS77USSG Steam Generator, 1.3-Gallon Capacity, 12' Hose, Steamer for Wood Bending, Steam Box for Wood, Portable Steam Generator, Steam Wood Bender
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 6 hrs 8 mins

features: WOOD BENDING STEAMER: The Earlex Steam Generator is the perfect tool to help you on your wood bending projects

LONG RUN TIME: The 1.3 gallon tank will provide steam for up to 2 hours in enough volume for a small to medium size steam box. Plus, the exterior water level indicator will let you know when to refill
PERFECT FOR ANY WORKSHOP: The small electric steamer uses a 1500 watt element to rapidly generate steam within your steam box. Its small footprint allows for convenient storage in any workshop
SIMPLE INSTRUCTIONS: Includes instructions on how to build a steam box, and a steam box connector kit so you can be bending wood the same day
BUILT-IN SAFETY FEATURES: The Steam Generator provides many safety features including a 12' cool to touch hose, thermal protection as well as an automatic suck back valve
body.description: Product Description Use the Earlex Steam Generator to bring new ideas to life and create unique furniture designs and woodworking projects with bent wood. The Steam Generator is the ideal steam source when used in conjunction with a steam box. It also features a new, enhanced casing that improves the surface touch temperature. This compact steam machine holds up to 1.3 gallons of water to provide up to 2 hours of continuous steaming, making it a great addition to any woodworking workshop. When you need to refill, the unit heats up in as little as 23 minutes (fill with warm water to reduce this time). The steam generator also includes instructions on how to build your steam box and a steam box connector kit so you can be bending wood the same day. From the Manufacturer Bring your new ideas to life and create new furniture designs and woodworking projects with bent wood. The Steam Generator works great for many wood bending projects. This compact electric steamer runs on a standard current with built in thermal protection, automatic suck back valve and pressure relief valve. Receive over two hours of steam per fill with the 1500-Watt element and the 1.3-Gallon capacity tank. The steam generator also includes instructions on how to build your steam box and a steam box adaptor.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Steam Generator for Wood Bending Great for Woodworking Projects The Earlex Steam Generator is a great tool for woodworkers who want to easily bend wood. The electric steamer generates high temperature steam within steam boxes to soften your wood for bending. No Chemicals Needed This wood bending steamer holds 1.3 gallons of water to provide up to 2 hours of steam time. No chemicals are needed, just clean water, making this a great chemical-free woodworking option. New Design The steamer features a new, enhanced casing that improves the surface touch temperature. The steamer makes bending wood safe with an exterior water level indicator, two thermal protectors, 12-foot cool-to-touch hose, automatic suck back valve and pressure relief valves. Features Great for softening and bending wood using nothing but steam No chemicals needed, just add water New, enhanced casing improves the surface touch temperature Holds 1.3 gallons of water for up to 2 hours of run time Includes instructions on how to build a steam box 12 ft. hose to easily reach your steam box Built-in safety features

How to Use 1. Build Your Wood Box The Steam Generator provides the steam and includes instructions on how to build your own steam box. The Steam Generator builds up steam within the box you created to easily bend wood. 2. Steam the Wood A general rule to follow is that you should steam the wood for 1 hour per every inch thickness of the wood. So for ½” thick pieces you should allow 30 minutes. The steamer reaches 212°F to quickly soften the wood for bending. 3. Bend the Wood Steam is a very effective medium for bending wood. Most hardwoods will bend better than softwoods. After the set timeframe, your wood will be perfect for bending into unique shapes!

How to Use 1. Build Your Wood Box The Steam Generator provides the steam and includes instructions on how to build your own steam box. The Steam Generator builds up steam within the box you created to easily bend wood. 2. Steam the Wood A general rule to follow is that you should steam the wood for 1 hour per every inch thickness of the wood. So for ½” thick pieces you should allow 30 minutes. The steamer reaches 212°F to quickly soften the wood for bending. 3. Bend the Wood Steam is a very effective medium for bending wood. Most hardwoods will bend better than softwoods. After the set timeframe, your wood will be perfect for bending into unique shapes!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price
reviews.reviewText: This is the cheapest way to get what you need for wood steaming. It works dreamy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use it for sealing old wine and whiskey barrels. Works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great, with one minor complaint
reviews.reviewText: I’m a woodworker, and purchased this for a few steam-bending furniture projects I’m building. I have not used it that long, but am happy so far. It works very well.The only thing I would mention is that I wish it had an inline switch. It’s not a big deal, but would make the operation easier. Unplugging the device is just a minor annoyance

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works Well to Bend Wood
reviews.reviewText: I just got started with wood bending when I got this unit. It's easy to operate, heats up quickly, and makes plenty of steam for the average one-off project. I have used it steaming wood in plastic trash bags (you can put the wood in the mold while it is still steaming), and using a collapsible gutter downspout (variable length, good diameter, and a square end for the stream line). It's pretty easy to attach the steam line to whatever you need, just drill a hole and screw the line on. The only thing that I would caution people is to say RESPECT that max fill line on the side of the unit. If you overfill the tank with water, it will trip the overtemp safety switch and shut down the unit until the water cools off. Since you have a lot of water in the tank in this case, that will be a long time. You'll end up having to dump out all that very hot water (not a pleasant chore), and starting from scratch. Not to mention what a way-too-short steam run might do to the wood you're trying to bend. This is a good way to bend wood if you follow the directions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my husband. He says it works great. Uses it with a steam box to bend wood.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Early review. Really early
reviews.reviewText: Rather cheap feeling but time will tell. It does, sort of, come with instructions, but so general as to be fairly worthless - instead, stating there are many websites to look at. Duh!Will return with update.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Puts out a fair bit of steam!
reviews.reviewText: When I received this steam generator, I was surprised how small it was; I had an image in my mind of it being bigger. None the less, I decided to give it a try. I've been pretty pleased with it. It claims it holds enough water for 2 hours' steaming, but if you fill it with cold water you end up getting just over an hour's worth of steaming before the low water shutoff is activated. But when I want more than an hour of steaming, I just put a pot of water on the kitchen stove, and when this steamer looks like it's getting low, I refill it with already boiling-hot water and can carry on steaming seamlessly. I've had good luck steam bending the inner gunwales for a 95-year-old wood-canvas canoe from Old Town.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Worked as advertised heats up incredibly fast really nice for bending. If you pre soak your wood before steaming it works even better

Unit works perfectly. I used it to remove thick ice from the edge of my roof. I added a 6" pipe nipple onto the provided brass fitting and was able to melt through the ice easily. Also used it to defrost my chest freezer. Once heated up, it produces steam for about 2 hours. No power switch, just plug in and wait about 20 minutes for it to start producing steam. Nice to have 12' hose to give lots of reach.

Leider fehlt der Adapter, in der Gebrauchsanleitung bei Technischen Daten wird angegeben das, dass Gerät nur mit 120V betrieben werden darf?? Was soll ich mit dem Gerät , da wir eine Netzspannnung von 220 V haben. Angaben sehr MANGELHAFT!!
Just worked only 2 times and very next day stop working. Not truning on. Don't know what to do. Is there any warranty available ?

reviews.reviewTitle: Did not come with an Australian plug and useless to me
reviews.reviewText: Sold on an au site and only works in the USA

Since this is my first attempt at steam bending, I was going by the "one hour per inch, 30 min per half inch" recommendation. To bend my 1/4" cedar strips actually takes 3 fills of the tank to get them pliable. It's a good thing I'm not in a hurry.October Edit: After spending a lot of the summer working with this, I'm updating. Making steam 10 hrs./day for months on end, I was afraid to see my electric bill, but, to my relief, it was not excessive at all.Now that I'm done steam bending, I have no idea what else to do with it.
